post_info.post_title: What is the evidence creationism causes harm?

Rather than looking at the percentage of creationists in the general population, you would need to look at those percentages within relevant fields such as medical research, epidemiology, bio-genetic research, etc. 
 
 To my knowledge, the percentages of creationists in such relevant fields is negligible, and there is certainly sufficient numbers of non-creationists to further research and continue to garner sufficient funding for research, planning, etc.
 
 A more pertinent question would be to ask how a creationist worldview (i.e., non-evolutionary, non-naturalistic, young earth, etc.) would impact research and methodology. Understanding this point naturally leads to the reason why there are so few creationists in medical / biological research fields.
